Spell Affinities

Spell affinities in Remixed Dungeon define which classes have access to specific types of spells and how efficiently they can use them. Each hero class has a primary magic affinity that affects spell power and mana costs.

Affinity Types

Common

  • Classes: All classes have basic access
  • Spells: General utility spells like Town Portal, Magic Torch, Body Armor
  • Benefits: Standard spell effectiveness and mana costs

Elemental

  • Classes: Mage has primary affinity
  • Spells: Fire, ice, and nature-based spells like Ignite, Freeze Globe, Root Spell
  • Benefits: Reduced mana costs and potentially enhanced effects

Combat

  • Classes: Warrior has primary affinity
  • Spells: Offensive and defensive spells like Smash, Die Hard
  • Benefits: Enhanced damage or effects, reduced mana costs

Rogue

  • Classes: Rogue has primary affinity
  • Spells: Stealth and agility spells like Backstab, Haste
  • Benefits: Enhanced stealth effects, better success rates

Huntress

  • Classes: Huntress has primary affinity
  • Spells: Nature and charm spells like Calm, Shoot In Eye
  • Benefits: Enhanced nature-based effects

Elf

  • Classes: Elf has primary affinity
  • Spells: Natural magic spells like Magic Arrow, Sprout
  • Benefits: Natural harmony with natural spells

Necromancy

  • Classes: Necromancer has primary affinity
  • Spells: Undead and death-related spells like Raise Dead, Exhumation
  • Benefits: Enhanced necromantic effects and control

Witchcraft

  • Classes: Plague Doctor has primary affinity
  • Spells: Magic and manipulation spells like Lightning Bolt, Roar
  • Benefits: Enhanced magical manipulation effects

Priest

  • Classes: Priest has primary affinity (Currently “Coming Soon” - Not available for normal gameplay)
  • Spells: Healing and sanctity spells like Heal, Order
  • Benefits: Enhanced healing and purification effects

Affinity Mechanics

  • Classes with primary affinity to a spell type get reduced mana costs
  • Some spells may only be effectively used by classes with the appropriate affinity
  • Affinity can also affect spell duration, damage, or other effects
  • Lower affinity may result in less effective spells or higher mana costs

  • Game Mechanics - Other important mechanics
